intro: Agathosma erecta var. rosea, commonly known as the rose-scented buchu, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in umbels, which bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in coastal regions. Its essential oils, derived from the leaves, are used in aromatherapy and traditional medicine.
